citation.article-title: Heliophilum fasciatum gen. nov. sp. nov. and Heliobacterium gestii sp. nov.: endospore-forming heliobacteria from rice field soils.

p.s: Cells straight rods, 0.8–1 μm x 5–8 μm.
Motile by polar or subpolar flagella.
Cells form motile bundles of a few to up to hundreds of cells.
Cells lack intracytoplasmic membranes or chlorosomes.
Heat-resistant endospores produced in newly isolated cultures.
Cells contain bacteriochlorophyll g and grow photoheterotrophically on pyruvate, lactate, acetate (plus CO2), or butyrate (plus CO2), and chemotrophically by pyruvate fermentation.
Utilizable nitrogen sources include ammonia, glutamine, and N2.
Absorption maxima of intact anoxic cells occur at 792, 480, and 415 nm.
Optimal growth temperature 37–40° C, and optimal pH near 7.
Growth inhibited by sulfide above 0.1 mM.
NaCl not required, and growth inhibited above 1% NaCl.
Type strain is H. fasciatum Tanzania, isolated from a Tanzanian rice soil, and is deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as ATCC 51790.
